column1: %	Apply "SimpleKMeans" to your data. In Weka euclidian distance is implemented in SimpleKmeans. You can set the number of clusters and seed of a random algorithm for generating initial cluster centers. Experiment with the algorithm as follows:
%	1. Choose a set of attributes for clustering and give a motivation. (Hint: always ignore attribute "name". Why?)
%	2. Experiment with at least two different numbers of clusters
column3: but with the same seed value 10.

column1: %	3. Then try with a different seed value
column2: i.e. different initial cluster centers. Compare the results with the previous results.

column1: %	4. Do you think the clusters are "good" clusters? (Are all of its members "similar" to each other? Are members from different clusters dissimilar?)
%	5. What does each cluster represent? Choose one of the results. Make up labels (words or phrases in English) which characterize each cluster.
